title: SHO energy - horizontal and vertical block-springs

content.prompt: Two identical blocks and two identical springs are arranged in separate block-spring systems, as shown in the figures. In System H, the arrangement is horizontal and the block moves with negligible friction on a horizontal surface. In System V, the arrangement is vertical. The blocks in both systems are set up to oscillate with the same amplitude in simple harmonic motion. Is the maximum energy stored in the spring the same for both systems? What reasoning can be used to support the claim?

choices.label: Yes. The amplitude of the oscillations is the same for both systems.
Yes. The two blocks have the same maximum speed.
No. The two springs are different lengths when each system is at equilibrium.
No. The period of oscillation is different for the two systems.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
